com.softwareag.natural.mapconverter

Interface IMapxmlTransformer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DEFAULTMapxmlTransformer

    public interface IMapxmlTransformer
    You can apply an own class implementing this interface to the rules file. To To add your own class, set the variable $$mapxmltransformer$$ correspondingly. 
      <convvariable dynamic="false" varkind="sys">
       <varname>$$mapxmltransformer$$</varname>
       <varvalue>com.somename.MyMapxmlTransformer</varvalue>
  </convvariable>

    See also the convrulesMultidimensionalArrays.xml in the njxmapconverter/convrules folder.

    The map converter performs the following steps to load the map extract files:

  • load the rows of the map extract file
  • identify sequenceAreas and gridAreas

    • These steps are performed before the map conversion phase starts. Classes implementing this interface are called after the steps are finished. This allows the classes to modify or extend the map extract. The classes must have a public default constructor.

    The com.softwareag.natural.mapconverter.converters.DEFAULTMapxmlTransformer class is a default implementation which is doing special transformations to support mapconversion of multi-dimensional arrays to GRID controls.

Author:
zim

    • Method Detail

      • discard

        void discard()
        This method is called when the Mapconverter releases all references to this object. Implementing classes are supposed to do clean-ups of possibly used resources.

      • findMultidimensionalGridIndex

        java.lang.String findMultidimensionalGridIndex(IExtendedIfField field)
        This method is called during identification of sequence and grid areas for each IfField object found in the map extract. The returned index is used for the identification of sequence areas and grids in IfFields of multi-dimensional arrays.

        The index returned from this method is later passed in the IMapxmlTransformer.isRowInMultidimensionalGrid to identify grid rows.

        Parameters:
        field - the extended field object
        See Also:
        isRowInMultidimensionalGrid(int, String, String)

      • init

        void init(java.util.Map globalVariables)
        This method is called after construction. It passes the global variables, which are defined in the rules file as name/value pairs.
        Parameters:
        globalVariables - as name/value pairs.

      • isRowInMultidimensionalGrid

        boolean isRowInMultidimensionalGrid(int row,
                                    java.lang.String previousIndex,
                                    java.lang.String index)
        This method is called during identification of grid areas in multi- dimensional arrays. The return value determines if a sequence area will be added as row number row to a grid area. The index of the sequence area to check and the value of the index in the previous row is passed.

        Returning true means: The passed index identifies the sequence area as the next row in the grid.

        Parameters:
        row - the row number of the grid starting with 0
        previousIndex - the index value, which identified the previous row
        index - the index value to check
        Returns:
        true if the index is valid for the passed row, false otherwise

      • transformAfterGridAreaIdentification

        void transformAfterGridAreaIdentification(MapxmlPage mapxml)
        This method is called after the grid areas have been identified.
        Parameters:
        mapxml - the MapxmlPage object

      • transformAfterRowsLoaded

        void transformAfterRowsLoaded(MapxmlPage mapxml)
        This method is called after the rows of the mapextract file have been loaded. It is called before the mapconverter identifies sequence areas.
        Parameters:
        mapxml - the MapxmlPage object
